cs.CL, cs.SI, cs.CY, cs.CR, cs.LG. 

The paper focuses on using deep learning to detect abusive behavior in social media, specifically Twitter. This falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP), which is a subfield of computer science that deals with the interaction between computers and human language. Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. 

The paper also utilizes metadata and hidden patterns within the text of tweets, which involves data mining and machine learning techniques. This could fall under the sub-categories of cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) and cs.CY (Computers and Society). 

Additionally, the paper addresses the issue of online abuse, which could fall under the sub-category of cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). 

Finally, the paper proposes a deep learning architecture, which involves designing and training neural networks. This could fall under the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning).
